free_txt: Entry deleted. Duplication with A0351

bib_record.title: Production cross section of radionuclides in (p,x) reactions at copper and nickel nuclei

free_txt: original reference
normal high resolution gamma-spectrometry
was applied. Nuclear data were taken from U.Reus et al.
At. Data, Nucl Data Tables 29, 2, 1983.
the error of the energy includes the
primary dispersion of the incident beam and also
the uncertainty of the energy loss in the Al foils
and in the target foils.
the overall error in the cross section
determination includes the errors:
flux measurements          10-12%
statistical error           1-3%
detector efficiency error     5%
nuclear data uncertaintty     1%
targets were irradiated with the extracted proton beam
with a beam current of 97 ma, a current-pulse duration
of 57 microsec and repetition frequency of 0.25 Hz.
the primary proton energies were 98., 70. And 36 MeV.
27 mg/cm2 Al foils were used to degrade the beam
energy. To calculate the stopping power and ranges
F. Joseph, Proton range and energy tables, at. Data,
Nucl. Data Tables, 27,3,1982 was used. The flux was
monitored via the reactions Cu-65(p,n)Zn-65 in the
energy region of 10-40 MeV and Al-27(p,x)Na-24 from
the target used were natural Cu 71 mg/cm2 thick
and Ni 88 mg/cm2 thick.
data were taken from tables 2 and 3,
nuclear data of the investigated reactions from
table 1 of the translated version of the article
